title: Read and Understand the Problem
text: The question tells us that Jamal rides his bike at the speed of $$12$$ miles per hour which means that every hour he is riding $$12$$ miles.
speech: The question tells us that Jamal rides his bike at the speed of  12  miles per hour which means that every hour he is riding  12  miles.
pacedSpeech: The question tells us that Jamal rides his bike at the speed of   12
miles per hour which means that every hour he is riding   12

title: Identify the Unknown
text: We are looking for the total distance traveled and we can name it "d"
speech: We are looking for the total distance traveled and we can name it "d"
pacedSpeech: We are looking for the total distance traveled and we can name it "d"

title: Translate
text: We can use the formula $$distance=rate time$$ --> $$d=rt$$
speech: We can use the formula  distance is equal to, ratetime  -->  d, is equal to r t
pacedSpeech: We can use the formula   distance is equal to, ratetime
-->   d, is equal to r t

title: Substitute
text: Since we are given that the rate is $$12$$ mph and the time is $$3.5$$ hours, we can substitute $$r=12$$, $$t=3.5$$ and get $$d=12\times3.5$$.
speech: Since we are given that the rate is  12  mph and the time is  3.5  hours, we can substitute  r is equal to 12 ,  t, is equal to 3.5  and get  d, is equal to, 12 times 3.5 .
pacedSpeech: Since we are given that the rate is   12
hours, we can substitute   r is equal to 12
and get   d, is equal to, 12 times 3.5

title: Evaluate
text: Evaluate $$12\times3.5$$ to find the distance in miles. What is the distance?
speech: Evaluate  12 times 3.5,  to find the distance in miles. What is the distance?
pacedSpeech: to find the distance in miles. What is the distance?
